Award.AwardTitle: Proposal for Support of the Doctoral Symposium at the IEEE International Conference on Cloud and Autonomic Computing (ICCAC)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award is to support the Doctoral Symposium at the IEEE International Conference on Cloud and Autonomic Computing (ICCAC) in Tucson, AZ, September 18-22, 2017. The doctoral symposium is meant to engage PhD students attending the symposium with interactions that provide the attendees with research and career mentoring. The primary objectives of the doctoral symposium are:
*Provide a venue for PhD students to present their research and obtain feedback from experts in the area. Students will be given the opportunity to present their research even if they did not have a paper in the main conference.
*Allow PhD students to present their work at the main conference's poster session. This will enable students to receive further mentoring about their research.
*Mentor PhD students by providing sound career advice from representatives in industry as well as academia.

The overall impact that such a meeting can have on PhD students, both early and late in their studies, can be invaluable. The findings at the Doctoral Symposium will be made publicly available to increase the dissemination of the keynotes and the results of the Q&A session on career mentoring.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project provided travel support for 12 Ph.D. students to participate in the Doctoral Symposium of the IEEE International Conference on Cloud and Autonomic Computing (ICCAC). that was jointly held with the FAS* Conference in Tucson, AZ in September 2017. ICCAC is the leading conference on cloud and autonomic computing techniques, foundations, and applications. This grant provided travel support to several female students in engineering. The financial support covered the costs of registration and travel expenses to Tucson. Overall the objective of the ICCAC Doctoral Symposium was to bring together Ph.D. students to present their research to their peers, network, and receive career advice from researchers in both industry and academia.

 

Overall, the travel support for the ICCAC Doctoral Symposium brings together students in the area of cloud and autonomic computing, and several from related areas such as machine learning.  The Doctoral Symposium allowed students to present their research to their peers as well as during the poster session of the main conference. Furthermore, the Doctoral Symposium concluded with a panel session consisting of assistant and full professors that have both industry and academic experience. These interactions led to a discussion about starting a teaching and research career and how to begin preparing for it.
